results.name: Expansion of (1+2x+6x^2+x^3)/(1-2x^2).
comment: Note that 4 is the only power of 2 not here. All terms are either 2^k or 5*2^k.
Note that 4 is the only power of 2 not here. All terms are either 2^k or 5*2^k.
link: Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (0,2)
mathematica: LinearRecurrence[{0,2},{1,2,8,5},50] (* or *) With[{nn=20},Join[{1,2}, Riffle[ 8*2^Range[0,nn],5 2^Range[0,nn]]]] (* _Harvey P. Dale_, Sep 28 2016 *)
xref: Cf. A094958 (numbers of the form 2^n or 5*2^n)
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
